intro: Anchusa ventricosa, commonly known as the bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, with showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and are known for their vibrant color and attractiveness to pollinators. Anchusa ventricosa is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
